page.title: 15COTTAGE HOSPITAL PENRITH
page.content: The Cottage Hospital was erected in 1898 and work finished in 1899.It was built to commemorate the 60th year of the reign of Queen Victoria.On the 20th July 1898 the foundation stone was laid by Mr.R. Haywood-Thompson, Chairman of the Eden Council Committee.The hospital was opened on November the 9th 1899 by the Lady Brougham and Vaux.The hospital is going to close because of the New Hospital in Penrith,and it also costs too much to run.Most of the nurses will be going to the New Hospital.There are 19 beds 6 of which are geriatric,so they won't be 'dumped' anywhere.If they where born in Penrith they will be transfered to the New Hospital.If they were not born in Penrith they will be taken to another geriatric ward eleswhere.
